entry.title: Bitcoin Core and hard forks
entry.summary: Pieter Wuille, a member of bitcoin-dev, cautioned against the risk of forks and pushing dramatic changes that could be dangerous to the network and its users. However, some members see allowing Bitcoin to become space-constrained without technical reason as a dramatic change. They question the reasons cited in support of such a move, which include various species of vaporware, amateurish economic thinking surrounding fees, and an infinite descent of not supporting it because not everyone supports it because they don't support it.
